com.poesys.accounting.bs.account

Class AbstractSimpleAccountDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDaoDelegate<S>
      • com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDataDelegate<BsSimpleAccount,ISimpleAccount,com.poesys.db.pk.CompositePrimaryKey>
        • com.poesys.accounting.bs.account.AbstractSimpleAccountDelegate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.poesys.bs.delegate.IDataDelegate<BsSimpleAccount,ISimpleAccount,com.poesys.db.pk.CompositePrimaryKey>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleAccountDelegate

    public abstract class AbstractSimpleAccountDelegate
extends com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDataDelegate<BsSimpleAccount,ISimpleAccount,com.poesys.db.pk.CompositePrimaryKey>

    A business delegate that provides an application programming interface for SimpleAccount objects and their dependents. You should not modify this class; instead, override or add methods in the class SimpleAccountDelegate, which specializes this class.

    Author:
    Poesys/DB Cartridge
    See Also:
    SimpleAccountDelegate

      • createSimpleAccount

        public BsSimpleAccount createSimpleAccount(java.lang.String accountName,
                                           java.lang.String entityName,
                                           java.lang.String description,
                                           java.lang.Boolean debitDefault,
                                           java.lang.Boolean active,
                                           java.lang.Boolean receivable)
                                    throws com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException

        Create a new SimpleAccount with data fields.

        The SimpleAccount class has no key of its own but inherits from a superclass that has a CompositeKey. When you create an instance of this class, the delegate creates a key of that type in the superclass.

        Parameters:
        accountName - the account name; unique within the entity
        entityName - composite super-key attribute that uniquely identifies child combined with child sub-key and any other parent super-keys
        description - text description of the nature of the account
        debitDefault - whether the account transaction items default to a debit or credit item; chosen as the "usual" value for items in this account
        active - whether the account is active at the present time; an inactive account does not appear in lists of accounts available through the user interface but does appear in reports where referenced by items
        receivable - whether this account is a receivable account, representing an asset that is a debt owed to the accounting entity
        Returns:
        the new SimpleAccount object
        Throws:
        com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException - when there is a problem generating the key or creating the object
